intro: Ranunculus pseudotrullifolius, commonly known as the false trillifolius buttercup, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, palmately divided leaves and showy, yellow flowers with numerous stamens. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
